Multiple social media posts and tweets: The expert's verdict mentions that there were multiple social media posts and tweets that claimed the Rampurhat Girls High School celebrated Independence Day with a Bangladeshi flag. These posts and tweets were shared by different users, providing evidence of the claim.
Photographs and videos: The expert's verdict mentions that there were photographs and a 44-second video clip circulating on social media that allegedly showed children holding the flags of India and Bangladesh during the Independence Day celebration at the school. These visual evidences were used to verify the authenticity of the claim.
Testimonies from school staff: The expert's verdict mentions that Alt News spoke to several people at Rampurhat Girls High School who denied the claims about promoting the national anthem and flag of Bangladesh. One staff member of the school, who was present at the event, stated that the 44-second clip was from a different program and that the Bangladesh national flag was only visible in that specific clip. These testimonies from school staff provided additional information to verify the claim.
Comparison of complete footage: The expert's verdict mentions that Alt News was able to access the complete footage of the school program, which included the 44-second clip circulating on social media. In the complete footage, it was found that the Indian national anthem was played before the Bangladeshi national anthem, contrary to the claims made in the social media posts. This comparison of the complete footage with the circulated clip helped in verifying the authenticity of the claim.
